etymology.description: 想 think + 起来 rise up = thought rises to mind → recall/remember.
etymology.interpretation: Indicates that a memory rises into awareness. Often used when something triggers recollection or when one finally remembers after trying.
etymology.simplification: 來 was simplified to 来 to reduce strokes; 起 remained unchanged, so 起来 reflects the standard simplified form.

parts.english: to think; to miss (someone); to want; to consider
to rise; to get up; to start; to raise
to come; to arrive; future/next; used after a verb to indicate direction/result

examples.chinese: 你一提醒(你一提醒)，我才想起来(我才想起來)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yì tíxǐng, wǒ cái xiǎngqǐlái.
examples.english: Once you reminded me, I finally remembered.

examples.chinese: 闻到这股香味(聞到這股香味)，我就想起来了奶奶做的菜(我就想起來了奶奶做的菜)。
examples.pinyin: Wéndào zhè gǔ xiāngwèi, wǒ jiù xiǎngqǐlái le nǎinai zuò de cài.
examples.english: Smelling this aroma, I immediately remembered the dishes Grandma made.

examples.chinese: 我怎么也想不起来他的电话号码(我怎麼也想不起來他的電話號碼)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zěnme yě xiǎng bù qǐlái tā de diànhuà hàomǎ.
examples.english: I just can't recall his phone number.
